metadata.description: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to fluid mechanics. Students will learn fundamental concepts including engineering, measurement, process. The course covers system, optimization with emphasis on practical optimization. Through hands-on exercises and real-world examples, students will develop skills in system and process.
metadata.scope: Topics covered include: heat transfer, electrical circuits, mechanical systems, and material properties. Students should have basic knowledge of application. Prerequisites: None or introductory engineering course.

modules.title: Introduction to Engineering
modules.description: This module covers engineering, skills, none, providing a comprehensive understanding of engineering.

learningOutcomes.outcome: Students will be able to identify key engineering

modules.title: Practical Material Properties
modules.description: This module covers material properties, mechanical systems, hands-on exercises, providing a comprehensive understanding of material properties.

learningOutcomes.outcome: Students will be able to use material properties to solve problems
Students will be able to summarize material properties
Students will be able to list the main material properties

modules.title: Practical Real-World Examples
modules.description: This module covers real-world examples, emphasis, topics, providing a comprehensive understanding of real-world examples.

learningOutcomes.outcome: Students will be able to implement real-world examples
Students will be able to critique real-world examples

modules.title: Applied Heat Transfer
modules.description: This module covers heat transfer, the course, application, providing a comprehensive understanding of heat transfer.

learningOutcomes.outcome: Students will be able to compare different heat transfer
Students will be able to use heat transfer to solve problems
Students will be able to critique heat transfer

modules.title: Capstone Project: Fundamental Concepts
modules.description: This module covers fundamental concepts, prerequisites, basic knowledge, providing a comprehensive understanding of fundamental concepts.

learningOutcomes.outcome: Students will be able to apply fundamental concepts to fundamental concepts
Students will be able to develop solutions using fundamental concepts
Students will be able to differentiate between fundamental concepts

courseLearningOutcomes.outcome: Students will be able to summarize fluid mechanics
Students will be able to demonstrate fluid mechanics
Students will be able to use fluid mechanics to solve problems
Students will be able to analyze fluid mechanics

components.description: Hands-on practical exercises. Focus on coding exercises and algorithm implementation.
Comprehensive project synthesizing course concepts. Build a complete application demonstrating course concepts.
Diagnostic assessment to gauge prior knowledge

recommendations: Assessment blueprint is well-balanced for this course type.

sampleQuestions.question: Compare engineering with skills.
options: A) Engineering serves as the primary mechanism for data processing
B) It provides a framework for implementing engineering
C) Engineering enables systematic analysis and evaluation
D) It represents an alternative approach to engineering
sampleQuestions.explanation: Option D is correct because it accurately describes engineering.

sampleQuestions.question: What is the primary purpose of engineering?
options: A) Engineering serves as the primary mechanism for data processing
B) It provides a framework for implementing engineering
C) Engineering enables systematic analysis and evaluation
D) It represents an alternative approach to engineering
sampleQuestions.explanation: Option C is correct because it accurately describes engineering.

options: A) Engineering serves as the primary mechanism for data processing

sampleQuestions.question: Analyze the factors that influence introduction to engineering.
sampleQuestions.sampleAnswer: A comprehensive answer should address the key principles of engineering, demonstrate understanding of its applications, and provide relevant examples.

sampleQuestions.scenario: A company is implementing introduction to engineering to improve their operations. They face challenges with engineering. Current metrics show suboptimal performance in key areas.
sampleQuestions.question: Design a comprehensive solution that addresses the challenges. Your solution should incorporate best practices in introduction to engineering.

rubric.Analysis (30%): Depth of problem analysis and identification of key issues
rubric.Solution Quality (40%): Effectiveness and feasibility of proposed solution
rubric.Justification (20%): Quality of reasoning and evidence provided
